title: How the hell does Ahri put her skirt on?????
body:
Ok, just look at {{champion:103}}'s splash art and tell me...

how the hell is it logistically possible for her to put on her short skirt? 

The lore says that she transforms from fox to human from time to time. Now I assume that when you turn into a human, you don't magically wear all these clothes. 

Now if you try to stretch a white short skirt over THAT MUCH foxtail the thing's going to snap (resulting in no skirt). If you buy a skirt and then cut a large hole in the back... there's still no way to put it on. 

Now someone tell me (not that one way necessarily makes it possible)... does the fox tail come out from UNDER the skirt or from a hole cut on the back of the skirt????? 

So HOW THE HELL DOES SHE DO IT?

I think the lore needs to account for this stuff.

I am here for one thing, and one thing only: 

The coccyx is at the bottom of your vertebral column, attached directly to the sacrum by an amphiarthrodial joint (and can become fused to the sacrum itself later in your life), and generally lies relatively close to your anus and serves as an attachment site for some muscles, tendons and ligaments in the region. As a result of its placement, if you have something protruding specifically from the coccyx without any change in its location and it's not covered by your pants, you're either an inner-city gangster or your pants are too low. If something was to protrude from the coccyx, it would likely go under or through the skirt, and, by necessity, would probably call for a wraparound skirt instead of one that would be pulled up, to prevent frustration and be faster with tails as large and fluffy as Ahri's. Though you could easily just pull something up to that tail joint without a problem, you're not going to be able to get above it very easily (important for a coccyx tail), which may or may not be important depending upon the exact location of origin for the tail(s) - and various media do depict tails, even in humanoids, coming from slightly different locations, meaning to properly cover it you'd need to either just drape something over, like a robe, or pull up to it and hope it's considered decent in polite society. Using Black Realm God's picture as a guide, that's not the coccyx you're seeing: that's coming off the lumbar vertebrae.

Welp, that's all I was here for.
